intro: Mariscus detersus, commonly known as the curled mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spirally twisted leaves and showy, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
